p: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) is a psychiatric disorder that may occur in people after experiencing or witnessing a traumatic event. This nosographic entity was previously included in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, fourth edition (DSM-IV) as an anxiety disorder, whereas in the latest edition (DSM-5) PTSD was classified under a category named “Trauma and stress-related disorders” [ 1, 2]. With a prevalence varying up to 5% in high-income countries, PTSD is often associated with significant comorbidity rates, relevant risk of chronicization, and substantial economic burden [ 3].
